Healthy.title: Your plant is thriving!
tips: Water the plant regularly without overwatering.
Ensure it gets sufficient sunlight daily (4-6 hours for most plants).
Dust the leaves gently for better photosynthesis.
Fertilize the plant once a month with a balanced fertilizer.
Repot the plant every 1-2 years to provide fresh soil.

Unhealthy.title: Your plant needs some care.
tips: Check for water stress (either too much or too little).
Ensure the plant is getting enough light (move it to a sunnier spot if needed).
Consider adding nutrients to the soil if it's depleted of nutrients.
Prune dead or damaged leaves to allow healthy growth.
If the plant's leaves are turning yellow, it might need more iron or nitrogen in the soil.

Pest-Affected.title: Pests detected! Time to take action.
tips: Inspect the plant thoroughly for visible pests like aphids, spider mites, or mealybugs.
Consider using an organic pesticide or insecticidal soap to get rid of pests.
Remove affected leaves and stems to prevent pests from spreading.
Use neem oil as a natural pesticide to treat pest infestations.
Ensure proper air circulation around the plant to prevent pests from settling.
